intro: Micranthes nelsoniana var. tateyamensis, commonly known as the Tateyama micranthes, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. This variant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
